name: Landdistrikternes Fællesråd
goal:
The Danish National Council for Rural Districts (Landdistrikternes Fællesråd) is an organization promoting common interests of the Danish rural areas. The council was established in 1997 with a vision of fostering growth and development in all parts of Denmark.

The council works on two levels - the general policy to ensure better framework conditions - and more citizen-oriented initiatives to create local development. This is done by collecting and sharing knowledge and having a tradition to participate in many different projects.
The Danish National Council for Rural Districts is a membership-based organization and closely linked with the political system. The council serves as a link between politicians and citizens and set the agenda in the media.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Employment and Social Affairs, Internal Market
